website_summaries.verdict: An effective soldering smoke absorber with an easily replaceable carbon filter. The closer you can get it to the source, the better.
pros: Effective carbon filter with some positive reviews
cons: Some owners say the motor puts out a bothersome odor

customer_reviews.title: Stinks and possibly bad for you
customer_reviews.text: While this works as a fume extractor, the smell this thing gave off made my chest hurt. Never had anything do that. Whatever they are using in it, they need to replace. I mean seriously, this stunk up my whole room and made my chest hurt from it. Will be buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: OK Smoke Absorber
customer_reviews.text: This smoke absorber is OK. It dos suck the solder fumes away. I'm not a big fan of the stiff power cord as others have mentioned, I don't think the cord needed to be this in flexible. The cord makes positioning the fan /absorber difficult at times. In general I just leave it in one position and let it run, so it's not always as effective as it could be. Fan volume is OK not overly loud, but definitely not silent, so I crank up the music a little louder ;)
customer_reviews.author: O. Riday

customer_reviews.title: It does the job; seems to be the standard choice for most doing this work; I agree
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. As mentioned in other reviews, the device has to be as close to the work as possible to catch all the smoke, but it's super powerful in that position and catches everything (no smoke in your room). Note: It's plug is two-prong AC so the EMF coming off this thing is super high; be conscious if how long you are near this while it's on.
customer_reviews.author: K. Outlaw II

customer_reviews.title: Well I used this last night and it started giving ...
customer_reviews.text: Well I used this last night and it started giving off a weird smell. Not Burning Wire smell, but something else around the fan in the back. Nothing seems to be wrong with it, just filled the side of the garage with that smell. Will see if it goes away. As far as absorbing I had this right beside my project and the smoke wasn't going near the absorber, rather back to my wall. So I placed the absorber to the front of the project and it did pick up the smoke.
customer_reviews.author: Gary 0765Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Absorbs fumes, but motor smells worse than the fumes
customer_reviews.text: Works okay as a smoke absorber, but the motor produces a strong smell (oil?) that's more pervasive than the solder fumes themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous55

customer_reviews.title: Good little smoke absorber
customer_reviews.text: I've built many kits and repaired quite a few devices over the past 50 years. I breathed a lot of smoke doing that. After using this smoke absorber I really wish I'd had it the whole time. Works like a charm. Without one of these the smoke seems to head straight for my face. With it the smoke is effectively pulled away. Better late than never I guess.
customer_reviews.author: JimW

customer_reviews.title: It certainly does suck!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Sucked that smoke right up. Normally I thought my face was so attractive that the smoke couldn’t resist it, but it’s no match to this smoke sucker. Thankfully I can now avoid the lead headache!
customer_reviews.author: Appelguy

customer_reviews.title: Works but not as well with torch
customer_reviews.text: It moves fumes away from your work area but would be best suited for a soldering iron instead of a torch. It needs to be pretty close to your work so it’s easy to accidentally burn it with a torch flame. I’ve done so using my Smith Little Torch on multiple occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix Mtn

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small apartment with limited ventilation, and soldering for more than a few minutes used to give me a bad headache. This smoke absorber completely solved the problem. I just position it within ~6'' - 1 foot of the work and it pulls the solder fumes away and through the filter. I haven't had to change the filter yet (or really notice any change to it at all), but when I do it will be easy: an extra filter is included, and it just clips on the back. Overall, highly recommend. You don't need a fancy ventilation system to avoid breathing in solder fumes!
customer_reviews.author: Arcflash

customer_reviews.title: this sucks!
customer_reviews.text: This is great, it sucks up smoke when I'm wood burning. there is still a mild odor while I'm working but it doesn't linger as it did before I got this absorber. I use this all the time and I even have 2 friends who decided they needed one for themselves. My only complaints are that this fan seems to be slightly off balance and tips onto its back very easily. And that it makes a bit of noise. If I'm talking to someone I dont have to yell, but I do have to speak a little bit louder than my usual indoor voice.
customer_reviews.author: still alive

customer_reviews.title: Does what it needs to do.
customer_reviews.text: High power solder extractor. It is a little loud, but it pulls the fumes away very well. I would have like the price to be a little lower as it is a fan with a stand and a filter. An extra filter was included which was a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: it didn't get better and I found this smell was worse than solder ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit emitted such an awful burning plastic-like odor, it stunk up my entire apartment to the point I had to open windows, doors, and turn on fans to air it out. I gave it the benefit of the doubt thinking that the odor would minimize with use per some other comments, but after two uses, it didn't get better and I found this smell was worse than solder smoke. I'm returning this and splurging for a more expensive unit.
customer_reviews.author: MBshopr1

customer_reviews.title: This is just right for my work bench. Sweet deal
customer_reviews.text: Very nice indeed. I was killing myself until I ordered this device. Now I can actually concentrate without poisonous fumes coming up at me. It has a very good draw and not loud for the air it moves.
customer_reviews.author: SIXM6N

customer_reviews.title: Solder smoke removal
customer_reviews.text: Pulls the smoke filled air away from my work space perfectly. It has to be in close to work but that's ok.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable as hell, effective too
customer_reviews.text: I used this fan for almost 8 months continuously (as part of a filtration system) and it worked like a charm. I must have dropped it off my table at least a dozen times, and it's just now quitting on me. I'd imagine that if I used it in any way resembling how it was supposed to be used, it would have lasted far, far longer. Can't reccommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah Y.

customer_reviews.title: I'm not convinced.
customer_reviews.text: It's a little weak. Unless you solder right next to it, the smoke escapes. Even the smoke that goes in it... how do I know if the lead is absorbed? The filter is so coarse, I am sure the vast majority of smoke particles escape it. It is quiet though. I'm considering creating a "fume hood" work area to mount it in, and vent it out a window.
customer_reviews.author: DMG

customer_reviews.title: It's good to about 1' of distance
customer_reviews.text: It's good to about 1' of distance, which is plenty. It's probably louder than you expect but it's not too loud.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Zebert

customer_reviews.title: Save your brain cells... good option.
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of getting dizzy/lightheaded after sniffing solder fumes for my hobby projects. This is a great unit and sucks away the smoke when soldering. It's fun to watch. You need to be working relatively close for it to work (I'd guess within 1ft). The only downside is that this think really has a funky smell when it runs.
customer_reviews.author: Greg H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice soldering accessory pulls funes away from your face - not super powerful - for that open the window and get a box fan!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine and as expected, but it is a little underpowered! Was not expecting a wind tunnel though, and it grabs most fumes and pulls them away from your face.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Flyer

customer_reviews.title: For the money, it's an okay product
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money but, you'd better have your solder job directly under the unit because it doesn't pull the fumes very hard. Probably wouldn't buy again, but I wouldn't return it either.
customer_reviews.author: Justin King

customer_reviews.title: Love This Product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product it does exactly what it's designed to do. A great product for the right price! My only suggestion if you solder alot like I do is to buy extra filters.
customer_reviews.author: TheLoveOfBooks

customer_reviews.title: Decent smoke absorber
customer_reviews.text: Does its job well. Not too terribly loud which is nice, and has decent pull on solder smoke but it does need to be positioned very near your work piece. There are certainly more powerful/quieter/more adjustable smoke absorbers out there, but for the price, this one is not a bad choice, especially as it's ESD safe.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: Got this at a great price, at least $20 lower than others I've seen. Its the same brand, same everything. Love this in my studio when I'm soldering, or using my pyroengraving pen. I found that you can rinse the filters a few times before you really have to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Soldering fumes
customer_reviews.text: I have found myself working more and more with physical computing, which requires more than a casual amount of soldering. This handles the fumes adequately for an amatuer enthusiast. But is a nuisance to position, and not particularly stable. That said, it is probably one of the better things I have done since I stopped smoking.
customer_reviews.author: Groaker

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Works great for pulling that solder smoke away as well as the smell. Soldering always irritated my throat, but not anymore. Didn't rate it 5, because it is a bit bulky and I have limited space.
customer_reviews.author: Jon C. Zaring

customer_reviews.title: ... has to be exceptionally close to the work to suck in the fumes
customer_reviews.text: It has to be exceptionally close to the work to suck in the fumes. It's unclear if the fumes are really being filtered out or if the fan is just mixing the smoke up. It does keep the flux fumes from getting in your eyes and directly into your lungs, so that is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Texifornia

customer_reviews.title: Pretty weak
customer_reviews.text: Unless you literally have this right on top of whatever you're soldering it has very weak suction. Not impressed, I was expecting it to be much stronger especially because the fan is also quite loud.
customer_reviews.author: H. K. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Nice desktop smoke sucker.
customer_reviews.text: This does it's job. It's a cute little sucker, the only complaint I have is in the power cord. The power cord is very thick and not very flexible, so it takes some maneuvering. But I look forward to using this with my PanaVise Model 201 Mini Vise, as it fits over it, and leaves room for more on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Joubes

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad
customer_reviews.text: The suction power is not big enough. You have to move it very close to the solder vise.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel NC

customer_reviews.title: When the fan does work the it produces a terrible burning smell even though I am not soldering
customer_reviews.text: Low quality product. When I jiggle the power cord the fan intermittently stops working. When the fan does work the it produces a terrible burning smell even though I am not soldering.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Yoder

customer_reviews.title: OK ?
customer_reviews.text: While the item does remove smoke and does a pretty good job of keeping down odor from glue I use,it gives off an odor of it's own. Only time will tell if this goes away or not.
customer_reviews.author: armormod23

customer_reviews.title: I gave it a little help getting going and it's been fine since. I've since started using a desk mounted ...
customer_reviews.text: Fan wouldn't turn at first. I gave it a little help getting going and it's been fine since. I've since started using a desk mounted arm solution but this is great for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Does not suck, which is a bad thing.
customer_reviews.text: Very wimpy suction. Regret not paying the extra ten bucks for the known good Weller unit.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Works well, not too loud about as much as ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, not too loud about as much as any fan. Definitely need to keep it close to where you are working to get its effect.
customer_reviews.author: Artur Shlifer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ok, a bit underpowered but if placed very close to the work will suffice.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Wish the fan were more powerful
customer_reviews.text: Wish the fan were more powerful, but otherwise does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: nukeduster

customer_reviews.title: Sure it will suck solder fumes but the AC fan will exhibit burning ...
customer_reviews.text: Sure it will suck solder fumes but the AC fan will exhibit burning plastic smell. Will leave you in a more worse foul smelling room then if you let solder fumes run free.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Unit died after only 6 mos of very light use!
customer_reviews.text: Just a couple weeks after the warranty expired, this unit died. I only used it at most 2-3 times a month since I purchased it. Looking for another brand now!
customer_reviews.author: L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job of keeping the burnt rosin away from my ...
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job of keeping the burnt rosin away from my face. Not as strong as some of the more commercial ones out there but does the job and nice to save money on these lower priced ones.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good air flow. Very happy with how well it pulls fumes away from my face when soldering.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Not a smoke absorber
customer_reviews.text: Effective as a fan and smoke mover, but far from a real 'absorber'. Included filters are too course to trap anything, all it does is move air.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Benchtop Solder Smoke Absorber
customer_reviews.text: A great addition to the wood burner's work station and perfect for use in classes! Compact size and light weight makes this perfect to take with you to workshops. The price makes it affordable for all artists!
customer_reviews.author: Dynva B. Todd

customer_reviews.title: There's probably a better one
customer_reviews.text: Very loud. Base not very stable. Heavy power cord wants to pull it over. No way to adjust height. Beyond those problems, it does its job. Comes with an additional filter.
customer_reviews.author: William Faulk

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend you keep the unit within 12 inches of your ...
customer_reviews.text: I use if for wood burning on gourds and it seems to draw the smoke away quite efficiently. I would recommend you keep the unit within 12 inches of your work for good absorbsion.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrie Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: This product does what it says: it absorbs smoke whilst you are soldering; however, I disagree with the review that stated it is "quiet." The AC fan inside (SUNOR SR100A P/N 12038HSL from China) is loud enough to become irritating after a few minutes of use. The price is right, though, compared to similar products.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Must be close to your work to draw the smoke away
customer_reviews.text: I like this smoke absorber, but it has to be very close to your soldering iron to draw the smoke away.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: Performs well!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! When soldering stained glass it works better than expected! Good value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Gale Goldenberg Carter

customer_reviews.title: broken
customer_reviews.text: it arrived in a very cheap box which allowed it to be broken upon arrival. It functioned well (according to my son), but, not as well as it could have, had it not been broken. My son did not want to return it despite my disapproval.
customer_reviews.author: maxine lund

customer_reviews.title: just what I needed to help me be lead fume ...
customer_reviews.text: just what I needed to help me be lead fume free working on my stained glass projects as a hobby. works well, handy size
customer_reviews.author: gene-o

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well for what it is, but the burning plastic smell is horrible
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but the plastic smell is terrible. After a few runs though the smell has subsided considerably
customer_reviews.author: jordan earls

customer_reviews.title: It sucks. Smoke, that is.
customer_reviews.text: It sucks. Smoke, that is. In the front, and out the back. Easy filter changes.
customer_reviews.author: Dan in NC

customer_reviews.title: Good stable product
customer_reviews.text: Works great if u keep it close to project that’s being soldered...
customer_reviews.author: Nancy  A. Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Smoke absorber
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to breathe in fumes when soldering,This is bad.This little unit can suck all of those toxic fumes and exhaust them away from your work area. And the price is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Larry A. Amati

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I woodburn on gourds and the smell is awful. Although I still wear a protective mask when using this product I cannot smell anything in the air. Great product, well, shipped and speedy delivery.
customer_reviews.author: bruderd

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wish it drew smoke from a farther distance, but if I am close, it does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle302

customer_reviews.title: It works just fine. Nothing incredible
customer_reviews.text: A fan with a filter. It works just fine. Nothing incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: No more soldering fumes!
customer_reviews.text: I use mine for soldering stained glass to remove the fumes and it works great!! The stiff cord doesn't bother me at all. Saw other reviews complaining about the cord. Came with two filters which is terrific. Would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Middlebrooks

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: not great and stopped working after just a few uses
customer_reviews.author: Lori Bowling

customer_reviews.title: Quieter than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Its quiet, powerful, and easy to assemble. It seems durable enough too!
customer_reviews.author: RedSquirrel

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Last
customer_reviews.text: It does a decent job of pulling fumes away from you if you keep it within 6 inches of where you're soldering. If it's any farther away, it's not effective. I have had mine for about 9 months, and the fan in it just died. I didn't use it all that often, maybe 4 hours a week. I will be looking elsewhere for a replacement that will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Krenz

customer_reviews.title: Good filter
customer_reviews.text: Does suck in and filter smoke, but needs to be close to what your soldering.
customer_reviews.author: Denise S. Bakker

customer_reviews.title: PREFER A LARGER VERSION
customer_reviews.text: just seems to be small...need to have it very close to my woodburning to be effective (and it tends to get in the way when that close)
customer_reviews.author: Ted L.

customer_reviews.title: Work as expected.  Arrived fast.
customer_reviews.text: Work as expected. Arrived fast. Better than what was available in the store nearby and cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Bench top smoke absorber for pyrography
customer_reviews.text: This little fan is being used to remove wood burning smoke from the air during pyrography. We have a small art studio and this fan removes almost all of the smoke and smell. It works great for what we use it for. It was recommended by several professional wood artists at several seminars we have attended recently. If you have sinus problems or an aversion to wood smoke this is a great product. It does not remove all but probably 90%. There for 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: James A Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Works good, you just have to keep it close to your work. Wish the cord was longer.
customer_reviews.author: E. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Poor Performer
customer_reviews.text: If you want to solder inside don't buy this, it is a lousy product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: constantly used
customer_reviews.text: This has been used for all soldering jobs in my home and works really well for drawing smoke plum from soldering.
customer_reviews.author: serenity83

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I make stained glass windows and this has been great to protect me from the solder fumes. It is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Shea

customer_reviews.title: This smoke absorbed was good. It suck all smoke to the fan and ...
customer_reviews.text: This smoke absorbed was good. It suck all smoke to the fan and it was doing great. A+
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Cornejo

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for a coworker, he's had no complaints about ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a coworker, he's had no complaints about it. Absorbs the solder smoke quite well and is not very noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Laura F.

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to my expectations!!
customer_reviews.text: This device has been a game changer for me. I no longer have to blow the smoke away while soldering.
customer_reviews.author: Andre J Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for that price, don't give 5 stars for power cable, too stiff..
customer_reviews.author: JOSE CORONA

customer_reviews.title: I'm pleased
customer_reviews.text: My previous review gave it one star as I was being asked for a review and the unit was two days beyond delivery with no unit received. I have subsequently received the unit and have found it works well and appears to be well made. The only negative has already been mentioned by others, the stiff power cable. I agree, it's too stiff. SRA Soldering was great in explaining the reason for the delay and I can't fault them at all. They have earned a return customer.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A Clausen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is small enough to stay out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Janet M.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, great price
customer_reviews.text: A must have for any solder station, great price and quality product. I recommend this product, don't forget to order extra filters.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Good, But shipping broke it
customer_reviews.text: arrived damaged, but nothing that superglue couldn’t fix. Ideal for code work onlt
customer_reviews.author: Pastor Rem

customer_reviews.title: Good product electric cable a little stiff comes with a ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product electric cable a little stiff comes with a carbon refill but the bar that holds it is a little cheap. But overall a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne A. Angone

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works and is affordable what else can I say?
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Had a Slightly odd smell during use at first but ...
customer_reviews.text: Had a Slightly odd smell during use at first but over a week it faded to nothing. Works pleasantly well for Soldering
customer_reviews.author: sean Funk

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Broken when I received it. Sent it back waiting for replacement
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Its a good cheap smoke absorber
customer_reviews.text: If you don't want to buy one of the 60 dollar Weller models this is what you want. Now let me tell you its not like the expensive version , and that would be a much better purchase. For example the fan is louder and off balance, its not as powerful, and the stock filter is total crap. But besides that this works and costs a lot less.
customer_reviews.author: middle.age.landsurveyor

customer_reviews.title: Good for hobbyist applications
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for light soldering and it works well to pull the fumes away from me. I'd recommend it for hobby-level soldering applications.
customer_reviews.author: Steverino

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended.
customer_reviews.text: It is very quite and pulls the fumes pretty well. Some fumes escape up, but the bulk of it is filtered by the fan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than my 5vdc pc fan I have been using.
customer_reviews.text: For a long time I felt like I could maybe make a fan with a filter in front for when I solder... Seeing this, I'm not sure I could make one as good for the cost of parts. This does a good job of sucking the smoke away from my face. I'm not a hardcore soldering expert, but this works more than well enough for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: You need this
customer_reviews.text: If you solder as much as I do, you need this to keep the smoke out of your face. It works well and it's quiet, and the price is fine for this sturdy fan. It is well built and worth the price. Happy soldering.
customer_reviews.author: kevin Patton

customer_reviews.title: The smoke absorber has to be sitting practically on top ...
customer_reviews.text: The smoke absorber has to be sitting practically on top of what you're soldering for it to absorb the smoke.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie Atchison

customer_reviews.title: Aoyue 486 Benchtop Solder Smoke Absorber
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product for me. I tested it and I didn't need to have my work right under it. It stands at a nice height to catch rising solder smoke. I would recommend this product. It came as scheduled if not earlier and it's worth the buy. It comes in a small box and you attach the stand and you're in business. It comes with a extra filter. Great item.
customer_reviews.author: Gelly

customer_reviews.title: does not seem very strong
customer_reviews.text: i have it right next to my stained glass project, practically on top of it, and i can still see smoke/fumes funneling upward above it, rather than toward it through the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly P Steinmann

customer_reviews.title: Smoke Absorber
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet while it is doing its job. I can see the solder smoke being absorbed from my soldering station even from a reasonable distance away. Priced just right, especially when compared to local electronics store.
customer_reviews.author: M. Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Not Effective
customer_reviews.text: This thing is useless. Not enough airflow to make any real difference unless you are soldering right in front of the unit, within 6 inches. The hose is a nice idea, but it just doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Russo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, definitely has a extremely stiff power cord.
customer_reviews.author: Jake S.

customer_reviews.title: Was a complete hazard
customer_reviews.text: The second I plugged the product in it made a huge spark from within the fan, a load pop, and a smoked. I immediately packed the item back up and returned it. Glad others had success with the product but I never even got to try it as it broke before ever getting to turn it on.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kauzmann

product_meta.title: Aoyue AO486 486 Benchtop Solder Smoke Absorber
product_meta.description:
Size:StandardIt's time to breathe easy! This bench top fume extractor removes soldering smoke and fumes quickly, safely and efficiently. Great for electronics, arts and crafts, and stained glass work.
Quiet yet powerful operation. Approx 37 cubic feet per minute airflow Activated carbon filter absorbs up to 80 percent of the odors from the air and is easy to replace ESD-safe by design Approx. 5"x5" filter area Unit measures Approx. 11"h x 8"w x 6"d One Extra replacement filter included.
feature_bullets: Great for electronics, arts and crafts, and stained glass work

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars223 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
